Key Arguments: Concerns about who determines the truth.
Belief that such measures are characteristic of non-democratic regimes.
The legislation undermines free speech and the ability of Australians to discern information independently.
Fear that the legislation could negatively impact future generations' freedoms.
Notable Quotes: I am absolutely in disbelief that Australia has come to this.
What is proposed is what one would expect to be enforced in countries of communist background, not a supposedly democratic, free society.
Nobody in history that has ever tried to silence people has ever turned out to be the good guy.
